title: Are there any gay gods or deities? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you are looking for it, you can find gay theme everywhere….I have a gay friend who is desperately in love with a straight actor and fantasizes about him all the time. Most gay stories start out straight….Zeus abducts a minor Phrygian sea god who is the lover of a moon goddess and over time the sea god becomes a boy in bed with an adult. Same with Hykinthos. As far as Jonathan and David go….Jonathan died because he abandoned his wife and children for a child who arrived in court when his son was born. Because of his betrayal his wife gets raped and his son crippled and humiliated….yet in the end it is Jonathan’s grandson who prophesizes the fall of Israel. David was a monster and Jonathan was a fool. BUT I don’t believe David actually existed anyway so enjoy if you want….I will loath because this is what happens to women and children in stories where the husband and father abandons his wife and kiddos.

I think that all the male gods of Olympus are bisexual. Also, Krishna sometimes, according to some myths, has sex with Shiva. And the original, first god of the Egyptian pantheon (whose name just now I forget), in order to beget the next two gods (whose names I also don’t remember—one male and one female) performs auto-fellatio on himself, and ejaculates into his own mouth—which seems pretty gay to me.

Are there any gay gods or deities? Yes, a lot actually. :D LGBT themes in mythology - Wikipedia LGBT themes in Hindu mythology - Wikipedia 52 Queer Gods Who Ruled Ancient History 15 LGBT Egyptian Gods

In the empire of Alexander the Great Macedonian, people revered the bisexual hero Hephaestion. He was not a god, but he was a hero. The cult of heroes was slightly less popular than the cult of gods in this time.
